title: Ancient Persia
description: The era of ancient Persia, including the Achaemenid Empire, which is considered one of the greatest empires of antiquity.

title: Medieval Persia
description: The era of medieval Persia, including the Seljuks and Mongols, and their impact on Persian culture and society.

title: Pre-Islamic Period
description: The period before the advent of Islam, featuring various empires and cultures such as the Achaemenids, Parthians, and Sassanids.

title: Islamic Period
description: The period following the advent of Islam, marked by the rise of various Islamic empires and dynasties.

title: Taherian Dynasty
description: A period of Iranian history under the Taherian dynasty (820–873 AD). Founded by Tahir ibn Husayn, a significant regional power.

title: Saffarid Dynasty
description: The Saffarid dynasty (875–900 AD) founded by Ya'qub al-Saffar, notable for its military expansion and administrative reforms.

title: Samanid Dynasty
description: The Samanid dynasty (875–999 AD) founded by Ismail Samani and Nasr I, notable for its cultural and scientific achievements.

title: Ziyarid Dynasty
description: The Ziyarid dynasty (928–1070 AD) founded by Mardavij ibn Ziyar, known for its cultural and architectural contributions.

title: Buyid Dynasty
description: The Buyid dynasty (932–1049 AD) founded by Ali ibn Buyeh, known for its significant political and cultural influence.

title: Ghaznavid Dynasty
description: The Ghaznavid dynasty (998–1160 AD) founded by Mahmud of Ghazni, notable for its military conquests and cultural patronage.

title: Seljuk Dynasty
description: The Seljuk dynasty (1038–1194 AD) founded by Tughril Beg, significant for its military expansion and role in Islamic history.

title: Khwarezmian Dynasty
description: The Khwarezmian dynasty (1078–1220 AD) founded by Anushtegin Gharchai, known for its conflicts with the Mongols and cultural achievements.

title: Ilkhanate Dynasty
description: The Ilkhanate dynasty (1256–1336 AD) founded by Hulagu Khan, part of the Mongol Empire, known for its role in Iranian history.

title: Timurid Dynasty
description: The Timurid dynasty (1370–1498 AD) founded by Timur, known for its significant contributions to art and architecture.

title: Safavid Dynasty
description: The Safavid dynasty (1501–1723 AD) founded by Ismail I, known for its establishment of Shia Islam as the state religion of Iran.

title: Afsharid Dynasty
description: The Afsharid dynasty (1735–1748 AD) founded by Nader Shah, known for its military campaigns and attempts to restore Iranian sovereignty.

title: Zand Dynasty
description: The Zand dynasty (1750–1795 AD) founded by Karim Khan Zand, known for its efforts to stabilize and unify Iran after a period of turmoil.

title: Qajar Dynasty
description: The Qajar dynasty (1795–1927 AD) founded by Agha Mohammad Khan, significant for its modernization efforts and interactions with Western powers.

title: Pahlavi Dynasty
description: The Pahlavi dynasty (1926–1979 AD) founded by Reza Shah Pahlavi, known for its modernization efforts and significant political changes.

title: Islamic Republic
description: The period of the Islamic Republic of Iran, established in 1979 by Ruhollah Khomeini, marking a new chapter in Iranian history.
